intro: Dimeria pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf dimeria, is a small, mat-forming succulent native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, exhibiting adaptations such as a thick cuticle to reduce water loss. Its growth habit is low and spreading, often forming dense mats that help stabilize soil in its native habitat. Dimeria pusilla is typically found in limestone soils and is a common species in desert ecosystems.
